required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating a Single-session Mental Health Intervention for UK University Students
clinical_study.official_title: An Online Wellness Intervention for University Students: Investigating the Efficacy of The Common Elements Toolbox in the UK

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators are evaluating if an online single-session intervention, the Common Elements Toolbox (COMET) can improve mental health and wellbeing among UK university students.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measure of depressive symptoms. Scores range from 0-27, with higher scores indicating greater levels of depression.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measure of anxiety symptoms. Scores range from 0-21, with higher scores indicating greater levels of anxiety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: Measure of wellbeing. Scores range from 7-35, with higher scores indicating greater well-being.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to four weeks post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: A measure of positive affect and negative affect. Scores on the positive affect subscale range from 10-50, with higher scores indicating greater positive affect. The negative affect subscale also ranges from 10-50, with greater scores indicating greater levels of negative affect.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (immediately after participants complete the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Measure of acceptability. Scores range from 4-20, with higher scores indicating greater acceptability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Post-intervention (immediately after participants complete the intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Measure of appropriateness. Scores range from 4-20, with higher scores indicating greater appropriateness.

intervention.description: The Common Elements Toolbox (COMET) is an online single-session intervention. It is entirely self-guided and lasts about 60 minutes. Participants complete a series of reading and writing exercises focused on four modules: cognitive restructuring, behavioral activation, gratitude, and self-compassion. The intervention is entirely unguided and completed in a single sitting.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
-
